body: I thought this bug could be closed up, but it looks like this test is still flaking. I can generate flakes on my desktop.

tools/run_tests/run_tests.py -l c++ -c tsan -n 1000 -r end2end_test

tools/run_tests/run_tests.py -l c++ -c asan -n 1000 -r end2end_test

Both lead to flakes@master as of now.
context->initial_metadata_received_  needs protection. I'll deal with it.
I believe that this will also help deflake qps_driver

My comment below is specifically with regard to a flake exposed by ASAN. This is timing dependent - it happens in the RPC Deadline Expires test of end2end_test. This stack trace is arising when the exec_ctx_flush happens because an alarm was caught during pluck. It should be easy to regenerate this failure on desktop with tools/run_tests/run_tests.py -l c++ -c asan -n 1000 -r end2end_test

This was tested at cb03e2a35e929ee709c7e2d53fccfe5845ce169c , but I know that the same issue arises on master at cd7bd2664cf0d3a132f4dbe5d5eeebcfe892bea6 .

[ RUN      ] ProxyEnd2end/ProxyEnd2endTest.RpcDeadlineExpires/1

# I0224 07:30:14.580502261    2488 end2end_test.cc:197]        Scenario: proxy 1, credentials TLS_CREDENTIALS

Doesn't look like we're seeing this anymore. Closing this as part of buildpony bankruptcy.

Feel free to reopen if you believe this is still something to address.
